      • autoRetrieveGeneratedKeys

        public ProxyDataSourceBuilder autoRetrieveGeneratedKeys(boolean autoClose)
        Enable auto retrieval of generated keys. When it is enabled, after executing query, it always call Statement.getGeneratedKeys(). The retrieved ResultSet is available via ExecutionInfo.getGeneratedKeys(). When this configuration is combined with proxyGeneratedKeys(ResultSetProxyLogicFactory), the proxied ResultSet will be returned from ExecutionInfo.getGeneratedKeys(). When autoClose parameter is set to true, datasource-proxy will close the generated-keys ResultSet after it called QueryExecutionListener.afterQuery(ExecutionInfo, List). This behavior might not be ideal if above layer, such as OR Mapper or application code, need to access generated-keys because when they access generated-keys, the resultset is already closed. To support such usecase, specify RepeatableReadResultSetProxyLogicFactory and set autoClose=false. This way, even though your QueryExecutionListener has accessed generated-keys, it is still readable at upper layer of the code, and they can close the generated-keys resultset.
        Parameters:
        autoClose - set true to close the generated-keys ResultSet after query listener execution
        Returns:
        builder
        Since:
        1.4.5

      • autoRetrieveGeneratedKeys

        public ProxyDataSourceBuilder autoRetrieveGeneratedKeys(boolean autoClose,
                                                        ResultSetProxyLogicFactory factory)
        Enable auto retrieval of generated keys with proxy created by specified factory. See detail on autoRetrieveGeneratedKeys(boolean).
        Parameters:
        autoClose - set true to close the generated-keys ResultSet after query listener execution
        factory - a factory to create a generated-keys proxy
        Returns:
        builder
        Since:
        1.4.5

      • autoRetrieveGeneratedKeysWithRepeatableReadProxy

        public ProxyDataSourceBuilder autoRetrieveGeneratedKeysWithRepeatableReadProxy(boolean autoClose)
        Enable auto retrieval of generated keys with RepeatableReadResultSetProxyLogicFactory. See detail on autoRetrieveGeneratedKeys(boolean).
        Parameters:
        autoClose - set true to close the generated-keys ResultSet after query listener execution
        Returns:
        builder
        Since:
        1.4.5

      • retrieveGeneratedKeysForBatch

        public ProxyDataSourceBuilder retrieveGeneratedKeysForBatch(boolean forStatement,
                                                            boolean forPreparedOrCallable)
        Configure generated-keys retrieval for batch statement and prepared/callable when auto retrieval is enabled. Since JDBC spec defines creation of generated-keys for batch executions are driver implementation specific, this method controls whether to auto-retrieve generated-keys for batch execution of Statement and PreparedStatement / CallableStatement. Setting is only effective when generated-keys auto-retrieval is enabled. Defult values are set false for Statement, true for PreparedStatement and CallableStatement.
        Parameters:
        forStatement - for Statement
        forPreparedOrCallable - for PreparedStatement and CallableStatement
        Returns:
        builder
        Since:
        1.4.6

      • repeatableReadResultSet

        public ProxyDataSourceBuilder repeatableReadResultSet()
        Enable resultset proxy that allows repeatable read. Equivalent to proxyResultSet(new RepeatableReadResultSetProxyLogicFactory())
        Returns:
        builder
        Since:
        1.4.3

      • traceMethodsWhen

        public ProxyDataSourceBuilder traceMethodsWhen(TracingMethodListener.TracingCondition condition)
        Enable TracingMethodListener. When given condition returns true, it prints out trace log. The condition is used for dynamically turn on/off tracing.
        Parameters:
        condition - decide to turn on/off tracing
        Returns:
        builder
        Since:
        1.4.4

      • traceMethodsWhen

        public ProxyDataSourceBuilder traceMethodsWhen(TracingMethodListener.TracingCondition condition,
                                               TracingMethodListener.TracingMessageConsumer messageConsumer)
        Enable TracingMethodListener. When given condition returns true, it prints out trace log. The condition is used for dynamically turn on/off tracing. The message consumer receives a tracing message that can be printed to console, logger, etc.
        Parameters:
        condition - decide to turn on/off tracing
        messageConsumer - receives trace logging message
        Returns:
        builder
        Since:
        1.4.4

      • buildProxy

        public DataSource buildProxy()
        Create a proxy DataSource.

        The difference between build() and this method is that the former returns a ProxyDataSource instance, while the latter (this method) returns a pure proxy DataSource instance. The ProxyDataSource instance is a concrete DataSource implementation that provides method callbacks only for the getConnection methods. On the other hand, the DataSource returned by this method is a pure proxy instance that triggers method callbacks on all of its methods.

        Returns:
        a proxy DataSource
        Since:
        1.10
        See Also:
        DataSourceProxyLogic, ProxyDataSource

      • build

        public ProxyDataSource build()
        Create a ProxyDataSource.

        The returned ProxyDataSource is a concrete DataSource implementation that provides method callbacks only for getConnection methods.

        Starting from v1.10, the newly added buildProxy() method returns a pure DataSource proxy that invokes method callbacks on all methods.

        Returns:
        a ProxyDataSource
        See Also:
        buildProxy()
